questions.question: During the initial stage of conductometric titration of HCl vs NaOH, what happens when NaOH is added to the HCl solution?

answers.b: The conductivity of the solution decreases gradually
answers.a: The conductivity of the solution increases gradually
answers.c: The conductivity of the solution remains constant
answers.d: The conductivity of the solution fluctuates randomly

questions.question: The shape of the initial portion of the titration curve for the conductometric titration of HCl vs NaOH is
Which of the following statements is FALSE about the equivalence point in the conductometric titration of HCl vs NaOH?

answers.a: At this point the pH is near 7
answers.b: At this point the conductivity abruptly increases
answers.c: At this point the phenolphthalein indicator will not show a pink colour.
answers.d: At this point the volume of the titrant is equal to the volume of the analyte.

questions.question: The factor that does NOT affect the accuracy of a conductometric titration is

answers.b: Inadequate stirring after addition of titrant
answers.c: Uncertainty in the volume of the titrant
answers.d: Presence of ionic impurity in the analyte.

questions.question: Why is the conductivity at the equivalence point not zero?

answers.a: The solution contains hydrated H+ ions.
answers.b: The solution contains dissociated NaCl ions.
answers.d: Some unreacted NaOH remains in the solution.
